reviews.text: We 2 adults and 2 teenage boys stayed 5 nights at Residence Foch. Family rooms are difficult to find in Paris. On entering the suite it was a little snug as the twin bed sofa bed was made up for our sons. The main bedroom made up for that small space. There was a king size bed, small sofa, table, 2 chairs and mini bar. Plenty of room for us all to be together, talk, or watch tv. There was also a TV in the boys room which had a sliding door. The bathroom was large, with double basins and separate toilet. The decor is quaint. There were many restaurants in the area to choose from. There was a supermarket and self service laundry about 5mins away. Staff were helpful. Major sites a delightful 20 min walk. Metro about 7mins walk.
reviews.title: Great for a Family

reviews.text: From the moment we walked in, we felt more than welcome. Perfect location, perfect staff, perfect breakfast everyone morning every time!! They went above & beyond to make us feel welcome & secure! This is the only place we will stay from now on!
reviews.title: SUPER....SUPER.....SUPER

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks again to ALL the staff, you're great!!!
reviews.title: Great location and helpful staff

reviews.text: The location and the staff were exceptional. We walked just about everywhere and it was quite convenient to be positoned in Paris to be accessible to the Metro and the many sights! Nathalie and Deborah were very attentive to our needs during our stay. Great place to be!!! Thank you!!!
reviews.title: Charming boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovey small boutique hotel. Friendly, helpful staff were very nice to our children.
reviews.title: excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights from the 3rd August, with my girlfriend. Our room was lovely with a large bathroom which was spotless. The neighbourhood was very quiet and our short walk to the Champs-elysees every morning was great to get to all the sights. The service was excellent and the people were warm and always happy to help. Thanks for making our perfect stay in Paris very comfortable!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel and lovely people

reviews.text: We stayed in a family suite (quad room) in July 2008. The room was about the size of two regular European hotel rooms with one bathroom. It had one king bed (two twins pushed together actually) and two other separate beds - a cot and a day bed. It really was perfect for us - a family of 4 with kids ages 8, 11. The location is OK - a 5 to 10 minute walk to the metro station with restaurants and grocery markets close by. The Arc de Triumph is a 10 minute walk and the Eiffel Tour 20 minutes. We had to take the metro to the Louvre and Notre Dame areas.
reviews.title: Wonderful little hotel with an exceptional staff.

likes.liked: — The staff's incredibly friendly and helpful attitude

reviews.text: The breakfast, although is an additional cost, was very good - your typical European breakfast with breads, pastries, yogurt, cereal, meat, cheese, dried fruit, and boiled eggs.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service at this hotel is perhaps the best service I have received in any hotel including many 5 star hotels I have stayed at. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly and I can't say enough good things about every single employee I encountered.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay in a great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In summary, there might be places to stay that are a bit closer to the main attractions, but the price (180 Euros for a family of 4 in high season) and more important, the staff, make this hotel highly recommended by our family!
reviews.title: Cozy and Cute Hotel

likes.liked: — Great location, clean rooms and friendly staff
likes.disliked: — Breakfast offered on day of check-in. We were not told that we would be charged for this one.

reviews.text: We arrived in Paris after a long flight from Australia. It's always nice to start a holiday in a good property and Hotel Residence Foch was perfect. Located in an upmarket residential area we saw a different side of Paris than previous visits. It was quiet, accessible to Paris attractions and we walked a lot as it was so pretty in the area. A 20 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower....we travelled with two teenagers who had their own room off our. Particularly pleasing was a large bathroom by Paris standards. The staff were friendly and very helpful too! All in all a great start to our holiday!
reviews.title: Delightful friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from a fantastic trip to Paris staying at the Hotel Residence Foch. The hotel was in a fantastic location about a 10 min walk from the Eiffel Tower and L'Arc De Triomphe. Also lots of cafe's and bars within a 5 min walk. The hotel was excellent and the rooms were spotless. The service every day was exceptional and we had a fantastic view from the hoow overlooking the top of the Eiffel Tower. I can't wait to return to the hotel and will definitelt book again in future. Excellent value for money
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Fantastic Location

reviews.text: The hotel was clean, very comfortable and staff were very helpful. The location was excellent 10 minute walk to the arc de triomphe. Good quality business hotel as were able to have quiet business meeting with good wifi connection
reviews.title: First Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This small hotel on a nice quiet street is well-run, clean and with a wonderfully helpful staff. It is a ten minute walk from the Arch de Triumph and a 20 min walk from the Trocadero. The rooms are charming but are very small, especially by European standards. This hotel serves a fine breakfast and many fine restaurants are at the end of the nearby Duret Street. If you are looking for a decent deal for a weekend or week, this is a good choice.
reviews.title: Good hotel that is quite close to Paris attractions.
Ideal
reviews.text: The staff and rooms at Hotel Foch were top quality. The room and breakfast were both excellent.

Hi on August 9th 2012 my husband treated myself and our daughter to a long week end here, my daughter hadnt been before but my husband and I had stayed at this hotel before. It was such a fabulous weekend, everyone at the hotel was lovely ( it was nice to see Isabelle again) always so helpful and the hotel itself was beautifully clean and modern. Breakfast was very good with such a wide choice of things to eat, it was more than enough. The location was excellent just a short walk to Champs Elysee and Arc de Triumph, when we did need a taxi to take us anywhere the hotel staff would get us one within 5mins. The whole experience was totally enjoyable and would definitely recommend staying at this hotel and we intend going back in the not too disant future
reviews.title: My Birthday treat from my husband

reviews.text: What a very good hotel. We had a suite and it was great. The hotel is located in a residential neighborhood, so not to much street noise.
reviews.title: A great 3 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was very clean, Beds very comfortable and the staff were all very friendly.
reviews.title: Just Got Better!!!

reviews.text: Breakfast was good and served with lots of smiles.
reviews.title: Return visit!

reviews.text: My 7 year old son was made very welcome, all in all we had a great stay and will return soon.
reviews.title: 3 nights at Hotel Residence Foch

reviews.text: Again my daughter and I went to Paris on a shopping trip but also its a landmark birthday this month for myself.!!!As always it was a brilliant experience from start to finish.
reviews.title: Another great stay at this hotel.

reviews.text: The staff are always so helpful and very kind. It was good to see Isabelle again and nice that she remembered us it made us feel at home. The rooms are exceptionally clean and towels bedding etc was spotless. Breakfast was more than adequate and is a good start to the day. The hotel is situated within easy walking distance to The Champs Elysees and The Arc de Triomphe the area is very safe and we went out to dinner every evening which was also very nice. I would highly recommend this hotel, this was my 4th time staying there and I will definitely be going back there in the not too distant future hopefully
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.text: We stayed in a beautiful family room (#40) separated to 3 areas: first room for the kids with a big sofa bed and flat TV; then a beautiful decorated large main room and a big modern bath; All in all bigger and nicer than any other hotel we stayed in Paris in the past. The room was clean with luxurious bedding and towels. The service was excellent. We recommend this hotel warmly.
reviews.title: Excellent family hotel

reviews.text: The only disadvantage is its location, about 15 min walk from Arc de Triumph in a quiet neighborhood and not too close to all the fuss in the city (some will view it as an advantage).
reviews.title: Just Wonderful!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Residence Foch for two nights in July on our way back to England from the South of France. We were looking for a decent family hotel towards the West of Paris with good access to all the main sights. The Foch met all of our requirements and more.
reviews.title: Everything and More

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel 3rd to 8th september and it was really lovely. The hotel staff were all so helpfull and friendly and happy. A special thank you to the reception staff who were really lovely. The hotel is very nice ,very clean and nicely kept .Its very conveniently placed for most of the main attraction and the area is very safe and theres numerous cafes and restaurants which are very good Del Pappa is Italian and theres another one which is also very good but we cant remember its name,its in a road called Avenue Malakoff , but you will fined all you need. Theres also some very good boulangeries in the area if you fancy some good cakes etc. We will definitely return to this hotel, and would recommend it, you should book early if you go though as its very popular .
reviews.title: lovely hotel and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Comfortable room in an old building in the embassy area of Paris. Close to metro and the tourist areas. The staff are excellent and extemely helpful.
reviews.title: Fantastic and friendly

likes.liked: — The staff and the comfort of the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading the reviews on this site I had high expectations and i was not disappointed. We stayed in this hotel for 1 night on the 20th of August. The welcome we received was very warm & very helpful. The twin room we had was more than adequate and very clean. The hotel is in a quiet residential area within a 10 minute walk of Champs Elysee. The reception recommended a fantastic restaurant only 5 minute walk from the hotel which was great value for money.
reviews.title: Great hotel would highly recommend!

reviews.text: A good location close to the Champs de Elyse and within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. In a quiet neighborhood, the rooms are nice and the hotel is charming and quiet. The best part of the stay is the wonderful man at the front desk who has the best tips for visiting Paris. He is delightful!
reviews.title: Delightful!

likes.liked: — The wonderful man at the front desk.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely hotel, the staff are very helpful, the rooms are small but very comfortable and clean. Breakfast was very good.We stayed with my son and daughter in law and we all thoroughly enjoyed everything about the hotel
reviews.title: This is a lovely hotel, the rooms are quite small but very comfortable

likes.liked: — The convenient area and the hotel staff

reviews.title: Loved Hotel Fotch
reviews.text: We stayed in rm 10 family room... We got there early... The staff was nice! Allowed us to leave the luggage with them while we went site seeing.. They explained the metro system n how to get to various locations such as the Eiffel Tower....
When we returned to the hotel our luggage was n our room for us.. The lift is too small for a stroller so they let us leave it downstairs with them!!
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.text: The room was NICE!! First part was a two twin beds.. Big enough for my 12 year old n two year old... Second room was the pack n at for the baby n our bed.. Had a chair n love seat... Both rooms had a tv n ours had air conditioner...
reviews.title: A Perfect Place in Paris

reviews.text: The bathroom had separate room for toilet, two sinks, n large bath tub shower connotation.. Was great!!!
reviews.title: Wow - Awesome place to stay

reviews.text: There was a nice bakery down the street we loved!!!
reviews.title: You can go home again!!!

reviews.text: I stayed at Residence Foch with my family at the beginning of June and everything was fine: very clean rooms, friendly staff and close to metro station... Nelly is gorgeous! 5 stars from all of us!
reviews.title: small but clean and comfortable

likes.liked: — it was generally clean and the staff was courteous

reviews.text: Stefano from ITALY
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel for the Price
Nice hotel, great location
reviews.text: I stayed here June 17-19 based on reviews I read here and for the price the experience was way above my expectations. From the airport I took the RER B line then switched to the RER C (at St MIchel Notre Dame) which has a Foche Ave stop. Its a five minute walk to the hotel from the exit (the exit is also right beside the Port Daphine metro station) and the hotel is in a beatiful neighbourhood. I arrived way too early for check in but I think they see this all the time as the staff told me I can leave my bags and go exploring. The staff are extra friendly and were more than happy to answer any questions. I must have asked them everything from directions, to restaurant recommendation to how to say phrases in french. I was travelling alone and the room was a bit small but it was perfect for me. It had all the amenities including a/c, iron with board, mini bar, tv etc..plus my room (#22) had a french balcony overlooking the street which was a nice touch. Bathroom was modern and everything was very clean and crisp. TV had about 20 channels everything from sports to movies to sit coms - but of course you're in paris so I don't know how much TV watching you should be doing. They also have a laundry service but there are dry cleaners in the neighbourhood. There is also a butcher, grocery store, bakery all within 5 minute walking distance of the hotel. There is a computer in the lobby with internet which is free to use to check your email or surf the net.

The hotel is near Foche and Ave de la Grande Armee both of which lead to the Arc de Triomph. The walk is about 10 minutes to the Arc and from there you can walk (or take the metro but really you should walk..) down Champ Elysees, maybe cut across Montaigne (as far as I can tell this is where all the high fashion stores are), across the Seine to the Eifell Tower and then along the Seine to anything else you want to see....
reviews.title: Charming Parisian Hotel

likes.disliked: — One of the rooms in our party smelled heavily of smoke (it was obviously a smoking room, but they accpeted this in order to get the benefit of the balcony)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has breakfast which I had one day. In most cafes you can get breakfast for about 5-6 euros maybe a little more and this will include a hot drink, a croissant, juice, half a baguette, butter and jam. The hotel breakfast is more expensive but you have a wider choice of jams, honey, nutella, cereal, different pastries and so on. I think if you're in a rush it might be worth it otherwie stop by any one of the 1,000,000 cafes :)
reviews.title: Ahhh, Paris!

likes.liked: — Fell in love with the decor and staff were excellent!

reviews.text: Our family spent 2 weeks in Europe this summer, and we discovered that it is difficult to find hotels that can accommodate a family of 4. Luckily trip advisor helped us find the Hotel Residence Foch. This is my first Trip Advisor review, and I signed up just to review this hotel. Everything about this hotel was absolutely wonderful. From the moment we walked in, and the manager Julian greeted us, we felt so welcome. The staff at this hotel are wonderful, it felt like we were staying with family. The room (#40) was very comfortable, quiet, and cozy. It had been remodeled with nice furnishings and a wonderful bathroom. The breakfast in the morning was very good, and had just what we needed to fuel up for the day. We highly recommend this hotel, and will definitely return here next time we are in Paris. The only negative I can think of is that cab drivers did not know the location of the hotel, and this was probably due to the location in a residential area...but the location was perfect, quiet, and a short walk from food and metro station.
reviews.title: Great hotel! Wonderful staff! Good for family of 4

reviews.text: I was frankly a bit dubious to stay here. The reviews were just a little too glowing and the price was just a little too reasonable. Like they say, if something seems too good to be true, it probably is. Well not this time. It was that good, and then some. In fact, in all my forty-five years, I have never stayed at a hotel that cared more or tried harder than this hotel did, and I would be remiss not to share my experience with other Trip Advisor readers. I arrived for a two day stay in Paris with my wife, our three young children and our nanny. I had asked for two adjoining rooms, one with a king bed for me and my wife and the other with four single beds for the children and nanny. Not an entirely easy request, especially in Europe, but the Hotel Residence Foch understood the request perfectly and the rooms, which were beautifully appointed and well-decorated, were great, as was the staff. These people REALLY care. And not like in a super-expensive hotel where you’re paying them to care. I mean, they truly want to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. They want you to be happy, they want you to feel comfortable, they are there for anything you need. But nowhere was this commitment to customer service tested as much as it was upon our departure for the Paris train station. We asked the front desk clerk, Isabelle, to call us a cab for six people (again, not an easy task, especially in Paris) and she was told it would be five minutes. But when ten minutes passed with no cab she called again and was told another four minutes. Then another ten. Then we were faced with the awful realization that we had surely missed our train. Around this time, the hotel owner, Nelly, showed up and was greeted by this frantic American husband and father at his wits end. But instead of shrugging her shoulders and letting the cab company take all the blame (as any other hotel owner would, especially after the bill had been paid!) Nelly immediately sprung into action and went above and beyond to an extent that fully explains why this hotel stands head and shoulders above the rest. Despite the fact that she was on her way home, and that she had a husband and two young children waiting for her there, this amazing woman escorted me to a nearby train office to try to exchange my tickets, assured me free rooms for the night if we were unable to do so, and, ultimately, paid for new train tickets for me and my family when all else proved futile. I realize my story is unique and I hope that nobody else has this same experience, but I cannot stress enough how much this hotel cares about its customers and it is reflected in every single aspect of their day to day operations – from the wonderful recommendations they give, to the lovely breakfast they serve, to the beautifully tasteful décor you see throughout the hotel. Words like “gem” and “find” are thrown around far too often in our society, but nowhere does it hold more truth than it does here. All the accolades this hotel receives are not enough to do it justice and I cannot recommend it more!
reviews.title: Not Enough Stars To Give!

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for our first 4 nights in France. It was easy to find from the Port Maillot metro stop and we were greeted cheerfully upon arrival. The room was small but very well furnished, quiet, had working air conditioning and good storage. The bathroom was gorgeous and obviously recently renovated. Throughout our stay we were always greeted personally and treated with superior care and service. Breakfast was included and was wonderful. The only negative would have to be the location. The hotel is located in a very nice upscale neighbourhood on a quiet street but it is relatively far from most Paris attractions. We couldn't walk to any restaurants or major attractions. The subway line is close and so is a Velib bike station so we managed just fine but it is worth noting that the location may not be ideal for everyone.
reviews.title: Lovely service oriented boutique hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is very conveniently located, in a quiet one-way street close to public transportation, velib station, Arc de Triomphe and the ring road.
reviews.title: True benchmark for Paris
Welcoming small hotel
reviews.text: Despite the name "residence" this is a true boutique hotel, about 6 floors with 4 rooms each. It has been recently renovated, has an immediate feel for an upscale 3 stars hotel. Part of the feel good sensation is due to large exposure to natural light both in the reception area and in the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For our honeymoon, we decided on Paris and Tuscany. For our hotel in Paris, we went through about 250 reviews on this website and decided for the value, location and based on past reviews, the Residence Foch was our best bet. We were not disappointed. We walked from the bus stop to the hotel in a few minutes and were immediately impressed. The front desk staff greeted us in English (does it show?) and while we tried our best to stumble along in French, we were soon both flitting back and forth in two languages. We had a terrific room and the washroom was the biggest we'd seen in Europe! The breakfast alone is worth the price of admission. It rained the first day of our journey, so we took the opportunity to battle jet lag. One of the nicest sleeps I've had.
reviews.title: More than you could ask for

likes.liked: — Staff are doing their best to belie the image of the snooty French service worker.

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.text: Loved the lift. It fit me and my outsized suitcase. Loved the bar. They make a mean martini if you ask them. Loved the location. You can walk to the Eiffel tower, Arc de Triomphe and the Bois de Boulogne. As has been said many times on this forum, the staff are what makes this a special little hotel. They are wonderfully helpful and can recommend the finest restaurants and the best way to see the city. They also arranged a great trip to Versailles and Giverny that was outstanding.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked through Otel.com, as we always do, and got a far better rate than any of the other websites or my travel agent could give me.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: Arrived at the hotel on 26th May with our 7 year old to find that Expedia had messed up the reservation and had booked a room for two instead of three. The hotel bailed us out of a potentially difficult situation and we had a fantastic stay despite the abnormally bad weather. The breakfast is very good, the area is safe, there are convenient restaurants/Bistros of various types and prices, the metro and RER trains are close (you can get from either airport with a couple of changes, and travel easily to any of the bustling areas of paris if you wish). What really makes this hotel stand out though is the owner Nelly, and her staff. She/they promote both the hotel and paris, and whilst I find staff in small French hotels generally very friendly, I can say that here they are the most helpful and friendly we have come across in many trips to France and will add value to your stay. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel (except on the week when I want to go there next). Finally, thanks to the others who left reviews and helped me choose this hotel.
reviews.title: What a great experience

likes.disliked: — Lack of full restaurant - breakfast, however, was good

reviews.text: PS. for those who don't speak French, they speak very good English
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in the embassy quarter of Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a double room at Hotel Residence Foch via Tripadvisor “Check Rates”, to celebrate our anniversary. My credit card was charged and I was given a reservation confirmation that was printed. After 14 hours of traveling and no sleep for nearly 30 hours we finally arrived at Hotel Residence Foch. We presented our reservation confirmation to the front desk and were told that the hotel was fully booked and despite us already having paid for the room and having our confirmation with us, the receptionist refused to give us a room. We were then told that Paris was booked solid due to a business convention and that it would be nearly impossible to get a room anywhere.
reviews.title: Beware! Reservations nightmare...

reviews.text: Hotel Residence Foch has a contract with the third party booking site that we used, as well as other on-line hotel booking companies that sell rooms on behalf of Hotel Residence Foch. These rooms are sold for a commission paid by the hotel. However, our reservation was denied by the hotel even though we had written and paid confirmation. We were told by the receptionist that there was nothing she could do about it and she was about to send us out on the street, luggage and all. It is my understanding that if a hotel overbooks, the hotel is obligated to find alternate arrangement and cover the difference in cost.
reviews.title: Great Location, Excellent Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This did not happen. We pleaded that she find us alternate accommodation, and after more than an hour waiting in the lobby she finally found us a room...on the other side of town right next to a busy train station.
reviews.title: We'd go back in a flash

likes.disliked: — If you have large bags, you have to walk from the Metro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My greatest concern is that the receptionist admitted that the exact same thing occurred twice earlier in the day and again all week long. It seems to be a re-occurring event.
reviews.title: Basic, Charming Hotel, Out of the Way Location

reviews.text: My advice is to you fellow Tripadvisor user is; Never book your room through a third party when traveling overseas. (IE clicking on that that yellow tab that says “Check Rates”). Instead, book directly with the hotel. And call to confirm many times! During low demand and lower rates the hotel feeds off the third-party services. However, when demand goes up, the hotel can charge much higher rates than the discounted rates through their suppliers and will only honor the highest paid prices, leaving you…on the street to fend for yourself in a foreign country. We booked the room for almost half of the listed hotel website price and this could have been a factor. I would gladly have paid more than double the price, but when the website gives you a price and a room confirmation, it should be honored. Period. There is no control over bookings and hotel policies at boutique hotels vs. major chain hotels. So Beware!
reviews.title: What a find!

likes.disliked: — A little too long a wait when checking in (one person only at front desk) but very kind

reviews.text: So clean. So comfortable. So friendly. Lovely room, bathroom really nice, beds so comfy. A pleasure to come back to after a busy day. Great breakfast, lovely friendly staff, really helpful and informative. Can't recommend highly enough. A great find and really close to Metro and RER lines for getting around.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel. Can't wait to return.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel Residence Foch from 22nd-25th August 2012 on our first visit to Paris. The hotel was lovely. It has recently been renovated to a high standard. Very clean with modern decor. The bathroom was lovely too. The room was much larger than I was expecting as I have heard that many hotel rooms in Paris can be on the small side. The bed was very comfortable, free wifi was included which was a bonus and there was also an in-room safe to store any valuables. The Air Con was appreciated too as it was very warm when we were in Paris. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. They supplied us with a map of Paris when we arrived which we used every day. The hotel is situated in a pleasant and quiet residential area yet the nearest shops and restaurants are only 2 minutes away. The Arc de Triomphe is roughly 10-15 minutes walk away which then leads straight on to the Champs-Élysées which has many shops, restaurants and cafés. We used the Metro a lot (Port Maillot) which was convenient and took us to the main attractions in Paris. The AirFrance airport shuttle bus arrives at Port Maillot from Charles de gaull Airport which we used at a cost of 15€ each. The journey time is around 30 minutes and saves the hassle of carrying luggage on and off the train or metro etc. We also used the shuttle bus the day we were leaving to take us back to the airport. Overall I would say that this was an amazing visit to Paris and would definitely stay at Hotel Residence Foch if I'm lucky enough to visit Paris again!
reviews.title: Amazing 3 night stay in Paris

reviews.text: A lovely hotel with extraordinary bathrooms. It's clean and the stuff is friendly. They provide free wifi service, and it is just 5 seconds walk from Champs-Élysées. The transportation is perfect, you can get here in about an hour by RER and the Metro. The breakfast is fine, but the nearby streets are filled with fine restaurants and coffe bars, so don't miss them.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel!

reviews.text: We booked to stay at this hotel having read so many positive reviews. We stayed in room 40 that had a couple of pull-out beds for the boys (a 13 and 10 year old) in the first room which then led onto another room with one of the largest beds I've ever slept in. The two rooms were separated by a sliding door which once closed felt like we were in a little luxury of our own. As much as it is lovely to share a room with ones children it is also nice to have your own space. Recently refurbished with a fantastic bathroom it really exceeded our expectations. The breakfast was included in the deal we had and I was dubious about what would be available. Delightfully surprised to find pastries, cold meats, cereals, fruit and boiled eggs. It set us up for the day.
reviews.title: Perfect family hotel in Paris

reviews.text: The staff were so helpful, enabling us to book up for the Eiffel Tower and The Louvre online thereby saving time and queues!!
reviews.title: Perfect!! (with the comfiest bed in the world!)

reviews.text: This hotel is wonderful! Located in a quiet up-scale Paris neighborhood, this charming boutique hotel is conveniently located close to the Metro and a variety of shops and restaurants. The rooms are spacious, beautifully decorated, and well appointed. The staff was friendly and could not have been more helpful. We will definitely plan on a return stay the next time we are in Paris.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!!!!

likes.liked: — I liked everything about this hotel and I'm hard to please

reviews.text: The first thing I noticed when checking in was a large sign on the reception desk saying "if you like this hotel, please write a review on tripadvisor.com." Well, it's pretty obvious that lots of people like this hotel, and after 3 days there I can see why.
reviews.title: Friendly, and all the basics done very well.

likes.disliked: — having the worst room in the hotel (but it was still perfectly fine)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although this hotel is not flash, and there's nothing fancy here, the basics are done very well.
reviews.title: Best Bet in Paris!!

reviews.text: Every staff member I encountered was extremely polite and helpful, and there really was service with a smile - a real genuine smile, and not a forced "have a nice day type" smile.
reviews.title: Best Hotel For Me In Paris!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was adequately sized, larger than other rooms I've had when paying the same price in Paris. The room was spotlessly clean, and well decorated. The bed was comfortable, the TV and air conditioning worked, there were tea making facilities in the room, and a separate chair. The bathroom was well equipped decently sized, and the shower powerful.
reviews.title: cosy little hotel

likes.liked: — Lovely staff, nothing too much trouble

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Hotel Residence Foch for 3 nights in May 2013. The Hotel was lovely and the staff were extremely helpful. The hotel is situated on a quiet residential street just off the Champs Elysees and a short walk from the Bois de Boulogne. Several excellent non-touristy restaurants/bars can be found nearby and both metro stations provide excellent links to the city. The hotel offers 2 types of room (standard and deluxe). However, if you check their website the deluxe rooms range from those which are slightly larger than the standard to those with balconies, Eiffel Tower views and even one with a huge terrace. Perhaps it’s obvious but if you pay for a deluxe room I’d advise to e-mail in advance and request the best room to avoid disappointment. The basic deluxe room was absolutely lovely and I have no complaints but it’s difficult not to feel a bit cheated when you know there are some amazing rooms for the same price! Hope this helps.
reviews.title: Contact in advance to get the best room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely small hotel, well located, beautifully appointed with generous, friendly and helpful staff and French chic to burn. The free wifi actually worked everywhere and the French breakfasts in the very small breakfast room were a lovely social event where everyone just had to share and cooperate. it was a very welcome change to the normally very impersonal experience in most hotels.
reviews.title: Wonderful base for exploring Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for five nights over the busy weekend of the Tour de France. The hotel is very pleasant, in a very nice part of the city, and with a couple of Metro stations a five minute walk away. The room was small, but very comfortable, and everything is to a good standard. The staff were all very friendly and helpful (they all spoke good English, we have a little French but not much) and I would recommend the hotel without reservation.
reviews.title: Long weekend in Paris

reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Foch. Close to 2 metro stations. Quiet neighbourhood. Surrounded by good places to eat. The staff were very helpful, assisting us in every way to make our stay the best. Free WiFi was a real bonus! Thank you to Hotel Foch.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.text: We just returned from a six night stay, and had a wonderful experience. We had a family room (room 20) which was spacious and comfortable for our family of four. Especially nice was the large bathroom with two sinks and plenty of counter space. Located on a quiet residential street, it is just a short walk along a tree-lined street to the metro station, restaurants, and a convenient market. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the small size of the hotel made the service feel very personal. We will definitely recommend Hotel Residence Foch to friends.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with wonderful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Residence Foch in July as a surprise Birthday getaway and what can I say - we simply had great experience and fantastic memories. It has been 7 years since I last visited Paris and to tell you the truth I had very mixed feelings when my husband told me that he had organized a week-end in Paris for my Birthday, I thought that I would much prefer a trip to Barcelona, but how wrong was I. We flew from Shannon to Paris with Ryanair and what was suppose to be 1h30min flight became 1h10min thanks to great flying conditions. From Beauvais airport there is a bus to Port Maillot and from there it is a very short walk to the Hotel. From the minute you step out from the bus and take first breath of Paris air you know that you are somewhere different and magical :)Although it was nearly 11pm by the time we made it to the hotel we were greated by a very nice receptionist, check in was very fast and smooth. We were given our key and shown to the elevator as our room was on the 4th floor. Hotel itself is very small, with narrow staircase and tiny elevator, but myself and 6'3 husband and suitcase didn't have any problem to fit in:) As my husband told me that he got exellent price from hotel's web site I didn't expect much from it, but I was wrong again:)Yes, room is on the small side but it has everything you need and bathroom is quiet big. In the room there are huge windows so you can open them in the morning and smell fresh bread and croissants:), there is flat screen TV, air conditioner and ironing board and what I liked the most - room has Paris character, you know straight away that this room could be only in Paris and nowhere else in the world. In the morning we had breakfast in the dinning room downstairs, it is continental but we definitely didn't leave the room hungry:) What I liked the most about this hotel - it's location, it is close enough to all tourist sites, only 2 min walk to the Arc de Triomphe, but far enough to be able to blend in with locals and it is located in a very quiet district as well. Also there are alot of great restaurants near by, the best we tried was a sea food restaurant (sorry can't remember the name) at the end of rue de Malakoff, 2 min walk from hotel towards Port Maillot with a great price of €37 for 5 course set menu (including oysters and foie-gras!!!) Staying in this hotel gave us such a great energy every morning and high spirit to go out and enjoy every minute of our trip and coming back in the evening felt like coming home:) It's been nearly 3 weeks since we came back but myself and my husband still raving about it and I am sure all our friends are tired to listen about it :) and we plan to come back in a very near future. When visiting Paris again we will only stay in this hotel, unless we won a lotto and could afford to stay in George V, I would love to try it out:) My only advise to anyone visiting Paris - take it easy, start your exploring of the city by just sitting outside one of numerous cafes with a cup of coffee or a beer, breathing Paris air and absorbing this fantastic atmosphere around you, watching people passing by and loving every minute that you spend in this fabulous city.
reviews.title: Perfect Location, great experience!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in Residence Foch for valentines day in Feb 07 - location was perfect, staff were great. Room was very small but was perfect for us, it had all we needed including a minibar and a very nice bathroom. We stayed for three nights in total, it may be a bit small for people on a longer stay (1 week).
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As mentioned in other reviews, it have a more of a B&B feel than a hotel feel so if you are looking for somewhere more like a hotel then I would look elsewhere. Would definetely recommend Residence Foch, the area was perfect, literally max ten mins walk from the Arc de Troimph, lovely safe area.
reviews.title: Delightful experience!

likes.disliked: — The winding stairway to our room -- I took the lift!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Hotel Residence Foch during our trip to Paris in March of 2007. Everything about the hotel was to our liking. The room for 2 -- comfortable and quiet; the staff -- extremely friendly and helpful; the location -- a safe neighborhood, close to the Metro. At first I thought the breakfast was a bit pricy but soon changed my mind after we ate breakfast elsewhere one morning. The food at the Residence Foch was plentiful and good -- it kept us going for several hours each day.
reviews.title: Top marks!

reviews.text: We booked a private van to and from the airport and that helped ease the anxiety of getting to the hotel and back to the airport in a city unfamiliar to us.
reviews.title: Cute, Parisien boutique hotel
Great hotel in 16th in Paris
reviews.text: We have just returned from our first trip to Paris, where we stayed at the Residence Foch for 5 nights. Everything was great, absolutely no complaints. The staff were warm and friendly, and really went out of their way to help. They spoke excellent English, which is great if your French isn't so good, and provide good recommendations for meals, tours and getting around. The 16th is a quiet - and nearly boring - part of the city, but public transport easily accessible and cheap to get anywhere else. We paid 160Euro per night, were very happy with value for money this represented, and happily recommend to anyone else.
I have nothing but positive things to say about this charming little hotel! I booked our stay based on other positive reviews and was not at all disappointed!
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel with Incredibly Friendly and Helpful Staff!

reviews.text: The room was small, but very nicely decorated and perfectly clean. Our room had a brand new bathroom with modern fixtures and a great tub/shower.
reviews.title: Excellent!!!

reviews.text: Our linens and towels were changed each day, which is not always the standard in European hotels.
reviews.title: Charming Parisian hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location was in a more residential neighborhood, but that is preferable, in my opinion, as it is quieter. It was only about a 10 minute walk to the nearest metro station (Porte Maillot) and from there you can easily get to any of the major attractions.
reviews.title: Fabulous Foch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nelly Rolland runs a wonderful small hotel that is perfect for couples and single travelers. Our stay from May 5-12 was absolutely delightful and mirrors so many of the other reviews. Nelly, Isabelle and the rest of the staff are gracious and helpful. Our room (41) faced the courtyard and was adequate in size with a nice bathroom. Closet space is limited, but we don't pack huge amounts so it wasn't an issue.
reviews.title: Outstanding small hotel

likes.liked: — Gracious management; small, cozy and hospitable.

reviews.text: A few notes on the area. There is a small market called Shopi just a short distance away near the corner of Rue Pergolese and Avenue de Malakoff good for a bottle of water or wine and some snacks. A larger (very upscale) market can be found in the lower level of the Galerie Commerciale L'Atrium du Palais des Congres (just across from the Le Meridien hotel where the Air France bus stops). Very nice takeaway food. Even better is the market across from Bon Marche at the Sevres metro stop.
reviews.title: Superb Little Hotel
Perfect!!!
reviews.text: We had dinner out at Le Petit Retro, a bistro recommended by Nelly, just off Place Victor Hugo; also at La Villa Corse, a Corsican restaurant on Avenue Malakoff (across from the Shopi market). We found both to be excellent; Villa Corse ended up being around 270 Euro for two, Le Petit Retro was half that.

reviews.title: Well, it says 3 star, and it is 3 star, but the staff do make a difference !
reviews.text: Porte Maillot metro station is large but less crowded than many and is also an RER stop. We found it easier to purchase our carnets (10 tickets for the metro) in the afternoon. The ticket windows were more crowded in the morning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the Louvre, exit at the Palais Royal Musee du Louvre and follow the signs to the museum. You can connect directly to the lower level of the museum where the ticket kiosks are and avoid the lines outside (we bought our tickets in advance via the web and avoided the ticket queue as well).
reviews.title: Simply the Best!

likes.liked: — Everything from the room to the staff made us feel comfortable in a foreign land.

reviews.text: We picked this hotel based on the excellent reviews and werent disappointed. It was without a doubt the friendliest little hotel I have ever stayed at. The front desk staff were so helpful and friendly giving advice on using the metro. The rooms were small but what you would expect from a boutique hotel. More impotantly they had everything you would need and were clean and comfortable. We had a nice breakfast with a good selection, in the breakfst room. Wouldnt hesitate to use it again when I go back to Paris. Its a shame more hotels dont follow their lead. Sincere & Considerate Customer Service is everything. Well done Hotel Residence Foch.
reviews.title: The Trip Advisor reviews are spot on. Fabulous Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a week from 13th August. We had a very comfortable room at the front of the hotel on the first floor. The hotel is very welcoming and the service unobtrusive making it an ideal place to relax and see the sights of Paris. Residence Foch is convenient for the Air France airport shuttle to Charles de Gaulle and also for the RER and Metro. The 2 day hop on hop off green and yellow bus was well worth the money and helps you get your bearings in Paris. It stops at the Arc de Triomphe which is easy walking distance from the hotel. The Batobus was also fun for a day as you can also get on and off as well as seeing the sights from the river. We did use the Metro towards the end of our stay, but generally walked everywhere and recommend visitors take a good pair of walking shoes! We can thoroughly recommend this hotel which is spotless and well situated in a quiet area of the city. The staff are exceptionally helpful and cheerful which undoubtedly adds to its charm. We would love to return to Residence Foch and visit all the attractions we missed first time around.
reviews.title: Hotel with loads of Parisian character

likes.liked: — It was spotlessly clean and well furnished

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It started with a nice Welcome e-mail after we made our reservation. I should have responded by asking directions, since we walked from the Arch de Triumph instead of from Port de Meioux. Arrived at 9 but didn't expect room to be ready, so Nellie, the owner, had us leave our bags, freshen up, and suggested a lovely walk and cafe. Lovely 15 minute walk to Trocadero. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We found the location to be very convient although not in the center of things. We are not high maintainence and found the hotel delightful. We only had 2 days so a big Paris suggestion is to buy tickets to the Yellow bus tour. There are 4 routes and you can switch from one to the other. See [--] enjoy.
reviews.title: Very friendly hotel, great location

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, clean rooms, good location

reviews.text: What a wonderful Hotel. The staff really makes your experience at this hotel more like a 5-star! The Hotel is situated in one of the best neightborhoods in Paris. My husband and I walked everywhere, took the metro and buses and we never felt creeped out coming back late at night. Our room had a great view of the neighborhood with its beautiful architecture, plants and flowers.
reviews.title: Well kept secret so shhh.....

likes.liked: — We had a continental breakfast included with our room rate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our Hotel room was always clean and nicely decorated in Parisen style, ask for the Blue room you wont be disappointed.....
reviews.title: It's all true! Fantastico!

likes.liked: — The 5 star service and attention to every detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had never been to Paris. We couldn't have found a better hotel. All staff were very friendly and helpful. Because of the reviews on Trip Advisor i had a good idea of what to expect and wasn't disappointed. We were on the 6th floor and our room was very comfortable with a lovely small balcony. The shower room was compact but more importantly it had a lovely strong shower not one of those horrible ones that just dribble out.. We enjoyed the breakfast which set us up for the day. Paris was beautiful nad Residence Foch was the perfect base for sightseeing and eating out. Thank You everyone, who wrote such good reviews, we were certainly not disappointed.
reviews.title: Charming and friendly hotel
Lovely.
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this lovely neighborhood hotel for 5 nights. We loved it. Everyone there was so helpful and friendly. Nellie was wonderful. You felt like a guest in her home. Her staff gave us great suggestions for where to eat...my favorite meal in Paris was at Bistro Saint Ferdinand just down the street. Go there!

reviews.title: Hotel Residence Foch: Great staff, great stay
reviews.text: We really loved the location of the hotel; in a quiet neighborhood, but so close to the Arc de Triomphe and Tour Eiffel and easy access to the Metro. If I had any complaint, it would be that our room...71...didn't have a stand up shower, just a tub with a hand held shower head. That being said, I wouldn't hesitate to return to this hotel.

Hotel Residence Foch: Paris made simple thanks to the kind and helpful staff at this charming small hotel. Many thanks to the tripadvisor travelers who recommended this hotel and who were spot on with their compliments. We asked the staff to make restaurant reservations for us by email before we arrived and they performed beautifully, emailiing us confirmation of our request and confirming again when we arrived. No question was too silly and no entry or exit passed without an interested and pleasant greeting. Rooms are small but well-appointed (this is Paris, rooms are always small!!) and location is fine with the exception that you have to walk a bit to the great streets filled with great people watching cafes and there is nothing right around the corner, so to speak. The advantage of this is that you are in a quiet block, walking distance to two metros, and not far from other pleasant attractions. Good breakfast too!
reviews.title: Like home away from home

likes.disliked: — some light noise in room - to be expected in older building

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Foch for 8 nights in May and had a most pleasing wonderful stay . Nelly and Isabelle were attentive and accomodating . We stayed in a family room which was spacious , clean, nicely decorated and comfortable. We always felt that we needed anything , it would be no problem , and this is a great feeling to have when you are in another country and language can be an issue. Close by is everything ( Shopi , Restaurants , Park , Metro , RER , Cafe , Money Exchange , Champs Elysees ) and the area is very nice and safe .Breakfast is nice , especially because if you feel like it it can be delivered up to your room . This is an intimate hotel , warm like a home .
reviews.title: 21-25 june 2007

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I chose this hotel for our 4 night stay in Paris after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. The reviews are not wrong: The hotel is lovely (room was small but perfectly formed), the breakfast was good, location was central and the service was 5 star.
reviews.title: Great hotel - even better service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights recently. The hotel was reasonably priced, clean, and the staff was very helpful with anything we needed. The neighborhood is an upscale residential area of Paris, very safe anytime. The subway stations and main thorofares are a short walk away. For Americans, with the exchange rate being weak right now, the continental breakfast at $17 each was a litle pricy for us, however there are bakeries and cafes within easy walking distance if you don't mind venturing out on your own. All in all, a nice place to stay.
reviews.title: Return visit to Hotel Residence Foch as good as the last time

likes.disliked: — Pricey breakfast but worth it for the convenience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Review is late since we stayed early May 2007 - but I wanted to write how much we enjoyed this hotel. We arrived early in the morning and our room was not ready. The staff allowed us to leave all our bags (there were a lot of them) at the hotel until the room was ready. The room was small (it is Paris), but was extremely clean and comfortable. The staff were excellent in advising how to get around and where to go. It is close to the Metro, and close to the shuttle to the airport but not the closest to the main attractions of the city - if you are planning to walk. A good 20-30 minute walk (though it was a great way to end the day for us) back to the hotel. It is on a side street so it is quiet at night - though at the same time if you are alone could be a little eery. Morning breakfast buffet was great. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in this hotel from Thursday 22nd May 2008 till Sunday 25th May 2008. We have no complaints whatsovever. We were delighted with the hotel and would go back there again.
reviews.title: Great little hotel

likes.liked: — hotel spotless, service first class, good breakfast. staff first class.

reviews.text: Location was great, near the metro, near good restaurants, away from the tourist areas yet with in walking distance of the Champs Eleyses.
reviews.title: J'adore Hotel Residence Foch

reviews.text: Staff were excellent, booked trips for us and recommended restaurants which were first class and good price.
reviews.title: Clean and Friendly

reviews.text: one of the best holidays we have had.
reviews.title: Who says the French aren't friendly?

likes.disliked: — A bit far from main attractions = Champs Elysee, Louvre, stores, etc...
